nodes.name: Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act
nodes.description: Federal law that requires financial institutions to explain their information-sharing practices to their customers and to safeguard sensitive data. It includes the Financial Privacy Rule, Safeguards Rule, and pretexting provisions.

nodes.name: Financial Privacy Rule (Reg P)
nodes.description: Governs the collection and disclosure of customers' personal financial information.

nodes.name: Safeguards Rule (Reg S-P)
nodes.description: Requires financial institutions to develop a secure information security program.

nodes.name: Pretexting Provisions
nodes.description: Prohibits obtaining customer information by false pretenses.

nodes.name: Breach Notification Rule (2024)
nodes.description: Requires notification to the FTC and consumers for breaches affecting 500+ people.

nodes.heading: Initial Privacy Notice
nodes.text: Provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects privacy policies and practices.

nodes.heading: Prohibition on Pretexting
nodes.text: It shall be unlawful for any person to obtain or attempt to obtain customer information of a financial institution by false pretenses.

nodes.heading: Breach Notification
nodes.text: Notify the FTC as soon as possible and no later than 30 days after discovery of a security event involving 500 or more consumers.
Designate a Qualified Individual to oversee the information security program.
Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) for any individual accessing customer information.
Implement procedures for the secure disposal of customer information (shredding/wiping).
Provide initial privacy notice to customers no later than when the relationship is established.
Provide a reasonable opportunity and method for consumers to opt out of third-party sharing.
Establish procedures to verify the identity of a person seeking information (Identity Verification).
Notify the FTC of any security event affecting 500 or more consumers within 30 days.
Oversee service providers to ensure they maintain appropriate safeguards.

nodes.name: Financial Institution
nodes.description: Any institution significantly engaged in financial activities (Banks

nodes.name: Customer
nodes.description: A consumer who has a continuing relationship with a financial institution.

nodes.name: Consumer
nodes.description: An individual who obtains a financial product or service (broader than customer).

nodes.name: Employee
nodes.description: Staff member of the financial institution who handles NPI.

nodes.name: Nonpublic Personal Information
nodes.description: Personally identifiable financial information that is not publicly available.

nodes.name: Personally Identifiable Information
nodes.description: Information that can identify an individual.

nodes.name: Account Information
nodes.description: Specific details regarding financial accounts.

nodes.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
nodes.description: Authentication requiring two or more factors (Knowledge

nodes.name: Encryption (Transit/Rest)
nodes.description: Cryptographic protection of data while stored or moving across networks.

nodes.name: Security Awareness Training
nodes.description: Regular training for employees on security risks and pretexting.

nodes.name: Secure Disposal
nodes.description: Cross-cut shredding or secure wiping of media containing NPI.
Civil penalties of up to $100
Criminal penalties including imprisonment for up to 5 years for knowing violations.
Cease and Desist orders requiring the stopping of illegal practices.

nodes.name: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)
nodes.description: Designated individual responsible for overseeing and implementing the information security program.

nodes.name: Board of Directors
nodes.description: Governing body that must receive annual reports on the information security program.

nodes.name: Cloud Infrastructure Provider
nodes.description: Third-party maintaining customer data (e.g. AWS Azure).

nodes.name: Payment Processor
nodes.description: Third-party processing credit card transactions.

nodes.name: Annual Security Risk Assessment
nodes.description: Written assessment identifying foreseeable internal and external risks.

nodes.name: Pretexting
nodes.description: Social engineering attempts to obtain NPI by false pretenses.

nodes.name: Phishing
nodes.description: Deceptive emails targeting employee credentials.

nodes.name: Unauthorized Access
nodes.description: Internal or external actors accessing NPI without permission.

nodes.description: SQL database containing NPI (SSN

nodes.description: Endpoint devices used to access financial data.

nodes.details: Provided at account opening describing data sharing practices.

nodes.name: Annual Privacy Notice
nodes.details: Provided annually to existing customers describing changes.

nodes.name: Toll-Free Number
nodes.details: 1-800 number for customers to call and opt-out.

nodes.name: Detached Form
nodes.details: Mail-in form included with the privacy notice.

nodes.name: External Marketing Firm
nodes.details: Third party company not owned by the financial institution used for marketing.

nodes.name: Hypothetical Breach Event
nodes.description: Unauthorized acquisition of unencrypted NPI involving >500 consumers.

nodes.name: Phone Pretexting
nodes.description: Caller impersonating account holder to bypass verification.

nodes.name: Email Spear Phishing
nodes.description: Targeted email to executive to install malware.

nodes.question:

nodes.question:

nodes.name: NERC Critical Infrastructure Protection
nodes.description: A set of mandatory cybersecurity standards enforced by the North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) to secure the Bulk Electric System (BES). It requires entities to identify critical assets and apply controls for electronic and physical security, personnel training, incident response, and recovery to ensure the reliability of the North American power grid.

nodes.purpose: Identify and categorize BES Cyber Systems and their associated BES Cyber Assets for the application of cyber security requirements commensurate with the adverse impact that loss compromise or misuse of those BES Cyber Systems could have on the reliable operation of the BES
nodes.scope: BES Cyber Systems categorization by impact level
nodes.name: BES Cyber System Categorization
nodes.applicability: All Responsible Entities that own or operate Bulk Electric System assets

nodes.purpose: Specify consistent and sustainable security management controls that establish responsibility and accountability to protect BES Cyber Systems against compromise that could lead to misoperation or instability in the BES
nodes.name: Security Management Controls
nodes.applicability: All Responsible Entities with identified BES Cyber Systems

nodes.purpose: Minimize the risk posed to Responsible Entities from individuals accessing BES Cyber Systems by requiring an appropriate level of personnel risk assessment training and security awareness
nodes.name: Personnel & Training
nodes.applicability: Entities with Medium and High Impact BES Cyber Systems

nodes.purpose: Manage electronic access to BES Cyber Systems by specifying a controlled Electronic Security Perimeter in order to protect BES Cyber Systems against compromise that could lead to misoperation or instability in the BES
nodes.name: Electronic Security Perimeter(s)
nodes.applicability: High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems

nodes.purpose: Manage physical access to BES Cyber Systems by specifying a physical security plan in support of protecting BES Cyber Systems against compromise that could lead to misoperation or instability in the BES
nodes.name: Physical Security of BES Cyber Systems
nodes.applicability: High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems and facilities

nodes.purpose: Manage system security by specifying select technical operational and procedural requirements in order to support protecting BES Cyber Systems against compromise that could lead to misoperation or instability in the BES
nodes.name: Systems Security Management
nodes.applicability: High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems

nodes.purpose: Mitigate the risk to the reliable operation of the BES as the result of a Cybersecurity Incident by specifying incident response requirements
nodes.name: Incident Reporting and Response Planning
nodes.applicability: High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems

nodes.purpose: Recovery reliability functions performed by BES Cyber Systems by specifying recovery plan requirements in support of continued stability operability and reliability of the BES
nodes.name: Recovery Plans for BES Cyber Systems
nodes.applicability: High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems

nodes.purpose: Prevent and detect unauthorized changes to BES Cyber Systems by specifying configuration change management and vulnerability assessment requirements in order to protect BES Cyber Systems against compromise that could lead to misoperation or instability in the BES
nodes.name: Configuration Change Management and Vulnerability Assessments
nodes.applicability: High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems

nodes.purpose: Prevent unauthorized access to BES Cyber System Information (BCSI) by specifying information protection requirements in support of protecting BES Cyber Systems against compromise that could lead to misoperation or instability in the BES
nodes.name: Information Protection

nodes.purpose: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of real-time assessment and real-time monitoring data while being transmitted between Control Centers
nodes.name: Communications Between Control Centers
nodes.applicability: Reliability Coordinators Balancing Authorities Transmission Operators

nodes.purpose: Mitigate cybersecurity risks to the reliable operation of the BES by implementing security controls for supply chain risk management of BES Cyber Systems
nodes.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
nodes.applicability: Entities procuring BES Cyber System hardware software services

nodes.purpose: Identify and protect Transmission stations and Transmission substations and their associated primary control centers that if rendered inoperable or damaged as a result of physical attack could result in instability uncontrolled separation or Cascading within an Interconnection
nodes.name: Physical Security
nodes.applicability: Transmission Owners operating at 765kV or above or critical facilities

nodes.purpose: Detect anomalous or unauthorized network activity within Electronic Security Perimeters containing high and medium impact BES Cyber Systems through Internal Network Security Monitoring (INSM)
nodes.scope: Internal network threat detection and monitoring
nodes.name: Internal Network Security Monitoring
nodes.applicability: High Impact BCS and Medium Impact BCS with External Routable Connectivity

nodes.purpose: Communicate to appropriate parties information related to potential physical threats sabotage or suspicious activities to facilitate identification investigation and appropriate responses
nodes.name: Sabotage Reporting

nodes.evidence_type: Process documentation | System inventory | Categorization records
nodes.description: The Responsible Entity shall develop a process to identify each BES Cyber System and the associated BES Cyber Assets to the BES Cyber System through either a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) architecture, a physical security control system architecture, a deployment of protection systems, or based on a methodology that includes consideration of equipment failure, cascading events within the Interconnection and operating experience, and update this identification at least once every 24 calendar months.
nodes.title: BES Cyber System Categorization

nodes.evidence_type: Security plan document | Approval records | Implementation evidence
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall develop implement and maintain a plan that includes the applicable security controls for its identified BES Cyber Systems. The plan shall include the applicable requirement parts in CIP-003-3 through CIP-003-11. Each Responsible Entity shall develop a plan for the security control of each applicable requirement part that includes: the roles and responsibilities of any electronic access; the implementation and maintenance of controls; training and security awareness for all personnel with access to BES Cyber Systems; the requirement to track and account for the removal of transient cyber assets; and the process for handling change.
nodes.title: Security Plan

nodes.evidence_type: Cyber security plan | Justification documents
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity that identifies one or more Low Impact BES Cyber Systems shall develop a cyber security plan for the Low Impact BES Cyber System(s). The Responsible Entity shall develop a plan for each of the following applicable requirement parts that includes: specify which of the applicable requirement parts in CIP-003-9.1 through CIP-003-9.4 are applicable to the Responsible Entity and justify any exclusions.
nodes.title: Cyber Security Plan for Low Impact

nodes.evidence_type: Risk assessment documentation | Background check results | Authorization records
nodes.description: For each individual who has access or who is responsible for access (including remote access) to a BES Cyber System each Responsible Entity shall implement a documented cyber security personnel risk assessment process that considers such information as reasonably available to the Responsible Entity through any of the following means: background checks; criminal history records; sex offender registries; financial records; and recommendations.
nodes.title: Personnel Risk Assessment

nodes.evidence_type: Training records | Certificates | Course materials | Test scores
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain a documented cyber security training program that includes at a minimum: the initial cyber security training for each individual who has or may have authorized cyber or authorized physical access to BES Cyber Systems and to High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Assets prior to such individual gaining authorized access; an annual cyber security training for each individual during each calendar year in which such individual has access or responsibility for access to BES Cyber Systems.
nodes.title: Personnel Training

nodes.evidence_type: ESP documentation | Network diagrams | EAP identification | Firewall configs
nodes.description: For each BES Cyber System at a High Impact BES Cyber System or Medium Impact BES Cyber System an applicable Responsible Entity shall establish an Electronic Security Perimeter(s) for the BES Cyber System in a manner that is consistent with standards for networking and system interdependencies.
nodes.title: Electronic Security Perimeter(s)

nodes.evidence_type: Access control procedures | Firewall rules | Authentication logs | MFA configs
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall: a) Identify all Electronic Access Points to the Electronic Security Perimeter(s); b) Implement and maintain methods to ensure that only personnel who have authorized cyber access are allowed to access the Electronic Security Perimeter(s) and to prevent intentional or unintentional misuse of the Electronic Security Perimeter(s) that could lead to a CIP incident or CIP incident.
nodes.title: Electronic Access Points

nodes.evidence_type: EACMS documentation | Monitoring logs | Detection records | Incident reports
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain at Electronic Access Points to the Electronic Security Perimeter(s) either one or more Electronic Access Control or Monitoring Systems that monitor and detect unauthorized access or shall implement and maintain a process that at intervals of not less than 30 calendar days for High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems determines the occurrence of unauthorized access.
nodes.title: Electronic Access Control and Monitoring

nodes.evidence_type: Physical security plan | Perimeter diagrams | Access procedures | Surveillance logs
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall develop and document a physical security plan and shall implement and maintain physical controls to protect BES Cyber Systems on Facilities by creating protected areas through the application of sufficient perimeter controls including: physical Security Perimeter(s) such as physical security zones protected by physical access control mechanisms or other physical obstacles.
nodes.title: Physical Security Plan

nodes.evidence_type: Surveillance footage | Incident logs | Investigation records | Law enforcement coordination
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain physical security monitoring and incident response procedures for all areas within the Physical Security Perimeter(s) that are identified in Requirement R1 Part 1.3 including: video recording of accesses to the Physical Security Perimeter; documentation and investigation of suspicious activities; coordination with law enforcement and other officials.
nodes.title: Monitoring and Response

nodes.evidence_type: Port inventory | Justification documentation | Service listings | Disabled service records
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall identify all active ports and services on each BES Cyber Asset within a BES Cyber System and justify the operational necessity of each active port and service. Each Responsible Entity shall disable all inactive ports and services.
nodes.title: Ports and Services

nodes.evidence_type: Patch inventory | Installation records | Compensating controls | Exceptions
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain a documented process for security patch management that documents the implementation of all applicable security patches. In any case where a patch is not installed the Responsible Entity shall document compensating measure(s) applied to mitigate risk exposure.
nodes.title: Security Patches

nodes.evidence_type: Configuration baselines | Hardening guides | Change procedures | Verification records
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain technical and operational cyber security controls to protect BES Cyber Systems against compromise. These controls shall include: policies and procedures to prevent the introduction of malware and eliminate unauthorized code; controls to prevent unauthorized modification of BES Cyber Assets; and configuration standards.
nodes.title: System Hardening

nodes.evidence_type: IR plan document | Contact lists | Procedures | Testing records
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain a plan for Cyber Security Incidents affecting High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems that addresses at minimum: identification documentation and notification of CIP Incidents to NERC and other authorities within 24 hours of discovery; data collection for forensic purposes; incident investigation and root cause analysis.
nodes.title: Incident Response Plan

nodes.evidence_type: Incident report | Classification documentation | NERC notification | RC notification
nodes.description: Upon discovery of a Cyber Security Incident each Responsible Entity shall determine whether the Cyber Security Incident is a CIP Incident. In making this determination the Responsible Entity shall document and classify the incident using a consistent process and criteria. If it is a CIP Incident the Responsible Entity shall provide the initial notice required by CIP-008-5 R1 to NERC and the Regional Entity.
nodes.title: Incident Reporting

nodes.evidence_type: Recovery plan document | RTO/RPO definitions | Procedures | Test results
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall develop and document a recovery plan or plans for its BES Cyber Systems that addresses: the objectives of recovery plans including the targeted recovery time and recovery point; prioritization of systems and assets requiring recovery; recovery procedures and testing protocols; identification of alternate processing sites if applicable.
nodes.title: Recovery Plans

nodes.evidence_type: Backup procedures | Backup schedules | Storage documentation | Test records | Disposal records
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain documented backup and restore procedures that address: full system backups; backup frequency based on criticality; off-site storage of backups; encryption of backup data; testing of restore procedures; and secure disposal of backup media.
nodes.title: Backup Procedures

nodes.evidence_type: Change management procedures | Request forms | Risk assessments | Test results | Approval records
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement a documented process that identifies and assesses all change requests to BES Cyber Systems including: identification of change scope; risk assessment; change authorization and approval; testing in non-production environment; implementation documentation; and baseline update.
nodes.title: Configuration Change Management

nodes.evidence_type: Baseline documentation | Monitoring reports | Configuration records | Change logs
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall establish and maintain a baseline configuration for each BES Cyber System that documents: operating system versions; software versions and patches; security settings; and network configuration. The Responsible Entity shall monitor the actual configuration at least once every 35 calendar days.
nodes.title: Configuration Baseline and Monitoring

nodes.evidence_type: Assessment reports | Scan results | Penetration test results | Risk ratings | Remediation plans
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall conduct and document a vulnerability assessment of BES Cyber Systems at least once every 15 calendar months using one or more of the following methods: security scanning; network or system penetration testing; vulnerability scanning tools; or manual analysis. The Responsible Entity shall assess discovered vulnerabilities based on severity.
nodes.title: Vulnerability Assessment

nodes.evidence_type: Information inventory | Classification records | Encryption configs | Access logs | Disposal records
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall: a) Identify BES Cyber System Information (BCSI); b) Classify BCSI by criticality; c) Protect BCSI at rest with encryption minimum AES-128; d) Protect BCSI in transit with encryption minimum TLS 1.2; e) Implement access controls for BCSI; f) Securely dispose of BCSI when no longer needed.
nodes.title: Information Protection

nodes.evidence_type: Communication encryption configs | Protocol verification | Certificate records | Test results
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall protect the confidentiality and integrity of real-time assessment and real-time monitoring data by implementing encryption using a minimum of TLS 1.2 or equivalent for all electronic data transmissions between Reliability Coordinators and Balancing Authorities.
nodes.title: Secure Communications

nodes.evidence_type: SCRM plan document | Vendor assessments | Risk registers | Notification procedures
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity that procures hardware software or services that are used in BES Cyber Systems shall develop implement and maintain a plan to mitigate cybersecurity risks to the BES that addresses: the processes for identifying risks associated with the supply chain; the measures to address identified risks; and the process for notifying the Responsible Entity of changes.
nodes.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan

nodes.evidence_type: Vendor assessments | Evaluation questionnaires | Risk ratings | Control documentation | Audit reports
nodes.description: Each Responsible Entity shall assess suppliers and service providers to the extent reasonably available through documented evaluation of: security policies and procedures; personnel security controls; security change management processes; incident response capabilities; and audit rights. The Responsible Entity shall document the assessment results and implement appropriate controls.
nodes.title: Vendor Security Assessments

nodes.applicable_entities: All Responsible Entities procuring for BES systems
nodes.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
nodes.description: Management of cybersecurity risks in the supply chain including hardware software and services used in BES Cyber Systems. Addresses vendor security assessment and supply chain visibility.
nodes.key_controls: Vendor assessment; Vendor agreements; Supply chain monitoring; Change notifications; SCRM program; Subcontractor management; Third-party access controls
nodes.risk_focus: Vendor compromise; Malicious code insertion; Hardware tampering; Software vulnerabilities; Supply chain attacks; Subcontractor risks

nodes.applicable_entities: Entities with High/Medium Impact BCS; CIP-014 critical facilities
nodes.name: Physical Security
nodes.description: Protection of BES Cyber Systems through physical security measures including perimeter security access control surveillance and monitoring of facilities containing BES Cyber Systems.
nodes.key_controls: Physical Security Perimeter; Access control (badges biometrics); Surveillance; Intrusion detection; Visitor management; Emergency access; Perimeter testing; Physical monitoring
nodes.risk_focus: Physical intrusion; Theft of equipment; Tampering; Sabotage; Unauthorized access; Natural disasters; Environmental hazards; Insider threats

nodes.name: Electronic Security
nodes.description: Protection through electronic/cyber controls including network segmentation firewalls access controls and monitoring of electronic connections to BES Cyber Systems.
nodes.key_controls: Electronic Security Perimeter; Firewalls; Access control lists; MFA; Encryption; Network monitoring; IDS/IPS; SIEM; Application whitelisting; Port control
nodes.risk_focus: Unauthorized network access; Malware; Denial of service; Data exfiltration; Unauthorized modifications; Lateral movement; Protocol exploitation; Reconnaissance

nodes.applicable_entities: All Responsible Entities with BES Cyber Systems
nodes.name: Personnel & Training
nodes.description: Management of personnel risk including background screening training and awareness programs to ensure only authorized and trained personnel have access to BES Cyber Systems.
nodes.key_controls: Personnel risk assessment; Background checks; Training programs; Awareness initiatives; Access authorization; Periodic access reviews; Termination procedures; Role-based training
nodes.risk_focus: Insider threats; Unauthorized access; Social engineering; Lack of security awareness; Credential compromise; Malicious insiders; Negligent access grants; Untrained personnel

nodes.name: Governance & Policy
nodes.description: Development and maintenance of documented cyber security policies and plans that establish the organization's security posture and compliance framework.
nodes.key_controls: Security policies; Security plans; Senior manager designation; Policy approval; Plan implementation; Governance structure; Roles and responsibilities; Policy reviews
nodes.risk_focus: Lack of security direction; Inconsistent controls; Compliance gaps; Inadequate governance; Accountability issues; Uncoordinated security; Policy misalignment; Leadership gaps

nodes.name: Change & Configuration Management
nodes.description: Management of changes to BES Cyber Systems and their configurations including documentation authorization testing and baseline maintenance to prevent unauthorized modifications.
nodes.key_controls: Change request process; Change authorization; Configuration baselines; Change testing; Configuration monitoring (35 days); Baseline reviews; Deviation investigation; Change logging
nodes.risk_focus: Unauthorized modifications; Configuration drift; Unplanned outages; Introduction of vulnerabilities; Loss of system integrity; Lack of change visibility; Unauthorized testing; Production impact

nodes.name: Vulnerability & Patch Management
nodes.description: Management of security vulnerabilities and patches including vulnerability assessments scanning penetration testing and timely application of security patches to maintain system security posture.
nodes.key_controls: Vulnerability assessment (15 months); Security patch management; Patch testing; Patch deployment; Patch exceptions; Compensating controls; Vulnerability tracking; Risk prioritization
nodes.risk_focus: Exploitation of known vulnerabilities; Unpatched systems; Security gaps; Delayed patch application; Patch failures; Compensating control inadequacy; Vulnerability accumulation; Technical debt

nodes.name: Incident Response & Recovery
nodes.description: Management of cyber security incidents and recovery including incident detection investigation response recovery plans and testing to minimize impact and restore operations.
nodes.key_controls: Incident response plan; Incident detection; Incident reporting (24 hours); Investigation & root cause; Containment procedures; Recovery plans; RTO/RPO definition; Backup procedures; Restore testing
nodes.risk_focus: Delayed incident response; Loss of critical data; Extended outages; Ineffective recovery; Forensic evidence loss; Compliance violations; Operational impact; Cascade failures

nodes.name: Information Protection & Cryptography
nodes.description: Protection of sensitive BES Cyber System information including encryption key management secure disposal and access controls to prevent unauthorized disclosure or modification of critical system data.
nodes.key_controls: BCSI identification; BCSI classification; Encryption (AES-128 at rest; TLS 1.2 in transit); Key management; Access controls; Secure disposal; BCSI inventory; Data loss prevention
nodes.risk_focus: Data breach; Unauthorized disclosure; Cryptanalysis; Key compromise; Encryption failure; Information loss; Regulatory violation; Competitive harm

nodes.name: Communication Security
nodes.description: Secure communication between control centers and between control centers and field devices including encryption and authentication to protect operational data and commands.
nodes.key_controls: Encrypted communications; ICCP security; Real-time data protection; Protocol security; Authentication; Integrity verification; Key exchange; Secure protocols
nodes.risk_focus: Eavesdropping; Man-in-the-middle attacks; Command injection; Data manipulation; Protocol exploitation; Session hijacking; Unauthorized access; Signal spoofing

nodes.name: Physical System Protection
nodes.description: Protection of physical equipment and systems including protective relays generators and transmission equipment from physical damage tampering or sabotage.
nodes.key_controls: Perimeter fencing; Surveillance; Access control; Tamper detection; Environmental controls; Equipment hardening; Cable protection; Equipment redundancy
nodes.risk_focus: Physical tampering; Equipment destruction; Cable cutting; Component theft; Environmental damage; Unauthorized equipment modifications; Cascading failures; Loss of protection

nodes.name: System Hardening & Baseline
nodes.description: Implementation of security baselines and system hardening to reduce attack surface and vulnerability exposure on BES Cyber Assets and supporting systems.
nodes.key_controls: Security baselines; Operating system hardening; Application hardening; Configuration standards; Baseline documentation; Baseline comparison monitoring; Deviation investigation; Annual updates
nodes.risk_focus: Unnecessary services/ports; Weak configurations; Missing patches; Uncontrolled options; Default credentials; Unnecessary protocols; Attack surface expansion; Lateral movement ease

nodes.name: Access Control & Authentication
nodes.description: Management of logical access to BES Cyber Systems including user identification authentication authorization and remote access controls using multi-factor authentication.
nodes.key_controls: User identification; User authentication; MFA (remote access); Authorization; Role-based access control; Remote access protocols; Credential management; Privileged access management
nodes.risk_focus: Unauthorized access; Credential compromise; Privilege escalation; Lateral movement; Insider threats; Shared accounts; Weak authentication; Brute force attacks

nodes.applicable_entities: Entities with High/Medium Impact BCS; some CIP-015 requirements
nodes.name: Monitoring & Detection
nodes.description: Continuous monitoring and detection of unauthorized access and suspicious activities through SIEM IDS/IPS and logging to enable rapid incident response.
nodes.key_controls: 24/7 monitoring; SIEM implementation; IDS/IPS deployment; Log aggregation; Security alerting; Anomaly detection; Real-time response; Log retention (90 days)
nodes.risk_focus: Delayed threat detection; Missed incidents; Log data loss; Alert fatigue; False negatives; Detection gaps; Slow response; Forensic evidence loss

nodes.name: Risk Assessment & Management
nodes.description: Periodic assessment of cybersecurity risks and threats to BES Cyber Systems and implementation of risk mitigation strategies to maintain acceptable risk posture.
nodes.key_controls: Annual risk assessment; BCS categorization; Impact analysis; Threat evaluation; Control assessment; Risk prioritization; Mitigation planning; Risk acceptance documentation
nodes.risk_focus: Risk blindness; Unmanaged threats; Inadequate controls; Compliance gaps; Resource mismatch; Unaddressed vulnerabilities; Strategic misalignment; Audit findings

nodes.name: Standards Development & Evolution
nodes.description: Participation in NERC standards development and adaptation to emerging threats and technologies to keep compliance requirements current and aligned with threat landscape.
nodes.key_controls: Standards review; Comment submissions; Industry participation; Technology evaluation; Threat tracking; Standards proposals; Compliance interpretation; Industry coordination
nodes.risk_focus: Outdated standards; Non-aligned controls; Emerging threat gaps; Technology mismatches; Industry coordination gaps; Standards interpretation variance; Regulatory uncertainty; Innovation barriers

rels.description: The 2024 Rule requires designating a Qualified Individual.
Financial Institutions must provide an initial privacy notice at account opening.
GLBA explicitly prohibits obtaining customer info via phone pretexting.
GLBA prohibits obtaining customer info via fraudulent statements (phishing).
Breach affecting >500 individuals triggers the requirement to notify the FTC.
GLBA requires overseeing cloud providers who handle NPI.
GLBA requires overseeing payment processors who handle NPI.
Multi-factor authentication mitigates the risk of pretexting/unauthorized access.
QI must report annually to the Board on the status of the security program.
Assessment identifies pretexting as a key social engineering threat.
Assessment identifies phishing as a key cybersecurity threat.
Risk assessment must evaluate risks to customer databases.
Risk assessment must evaluate risks to employee devices.
Privacy notice must detail the toll-free number for opting out.
Opt-out rights apply to sharing with non-affiliated marketing firms.
